content:
<ce:para view="all">Crystal preparations: An aqueous solution of equimolar quantities of europium perchlorate and H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>CDTA was heated at ca. 80<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. Next, solid [C(NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> was added until the pH value was 5. Large colourless crystals of [C(NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>[Eu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(CDTA)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]ClO<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>7H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>I</ce:bold>) were formed during slow evaporation. The other crystals, [C(NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>][Eu(CDTA)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)]<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2.375H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (<ce:bold>II</ce:bold>), were obtained as follows: a suspension of Eu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> and H<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>CDTA was heated at ca. 80<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. After dissolution of the substrates, the solution was alkalized with [C(NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>]<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>CO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> to a final pH value of 3, and left for crystallization.</ce:para>
clean_text: Crystal preparations: An aqueous solution of equimolar quantities of europium perchlorate and H4CDTA was heated at ca. 80°C. Next, solid [C(NH2)3]2CO3 was added until the pH value was 5. Large colourless crystals of [C(NH2)3]3[Eu2(CDTA)2(H2O)2]ClO4 ⋅7H2O (I) were formed during slow evaporation. The other crystals, [C(NH2)3][Eu(CDTA)(H2O)]⋅2.375H2O (II), were obtained as follows: a suspension of Eu2O3 and H4CDTA was heated at ca. 80°C. After dissolution of the substrates, the solution was alkalized with [C(NH2)3]2CO3 to a final pH value of 3, and left for crystallization.
